verses.verse: A prayer <S%H8605><s%> of Habakkuk <S%H2265><s%> the prophet, <S%H5030><s%> according <S%H5921><s%> to Shigionoth. <S%H7692><s%>

Lord, <S%H3068><s%> I have heard <S%H8085><s%> the report <S%H8088><s%> about Thee [and] I fear. <S%H3372><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> revive <S%H2421><s%> Thy work <S%H6467><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the years, <S%H8141><s%> In the midst <S%H7130><s%> of the years <S%H8141><s%> make <S%H3045><s%> it known; <S%H3045><s%> In wrath <S%H7267><s%> remember <S%H2142><s%> mercy. <S%H7355><s%>

God <S%H433><s%> comes <S%H935><s%> from Teman, <S%H8487><s%> And the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One <S%H6918><s%> from Mount <S%H2022><s%> Paran. <S%H6290><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%> His splendor <S%H1935><s%> covers <S%H3680><s%> the heavens, <S%H8064><s%> And the earth <S%H776><s%> is full <S%H4390><s%> of His praise. <S%H8416><s%>

[His] radiance <S%H5051><s%> is like the sunlight; <S%H216><s%> He has rays <S%H7161><s%> [flashing] from His hand, <S%H3027><s%> And there <S%H8033><s%> is the hiding <S%H2253><s%> of His power. <S%H5797><s%>
Before <S%H6440><s%> Him goes <S%H1980><s%> pestilence, <S%H1698><s%> And plague <S%H7565><s%> comes <S%H3318><s%> after <S%H7272><s%> Him.

He stood <S%H5975><s%> and surveyed <S%H4058><s%> the earth; <S%H776><s%> He looked <S%H7200><s%> and startled <S%H9351><s%> the nations. <S%H1471><s%> Yes, the perpetual <S%H5703><s%> mountains <S%H2022><s%> were shattered, <S%H9455><s%> The ancient <S%H5769><s%> hills <S%H1389><s%> collapsed. <S%H7817><s%> His ways <S%H1979><s%> are everlasting. <S%H5769><s%>

I saw <S%H7200><s%> the tents <S%H168><s%> of Cushan <S%H3572><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> distress, <S%H205><s%> The tent <S%H3407><s%> curtains <S%H3407><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> of Midian <S%H4080><s%> were trembling. <S%H7264><s%>

Did the Lord <S%H3068><s%> rage <S%H2734><s%> against the rivers, <S%H5104><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> [was] Thine anger <S%H639><s%> against the rivers, <S%H5104><s%> Or <S%H518><s%> [was] Thy wrath <S%H5678><s%> against the sea, <S%H3220><s%> That Thou didst ride <S%H7392><s%> on Thy horses, <S%H5483><s%> On Thy chariots <S%H4818><s%> of salvation <S%H3444><s%>?

Thy bow <S%H7198><s%> was made <S%H5783><s%> bare, <S%H6181><s%> <S%H5783><s%> The rods <S%H4294><s%> of chastisement <S%H561><s%> were sworn. <S%H7621><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%> Thou didst cleave <S%H1234><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> with rivers. <S%H5104><s%>

The mountains <S%H2022><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Thee [and] quaked; <S%H9123><s%> The downpour <S%H2230><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> swept <S%H5674><s%> by. The deep <S%H8415><s%> uttered <S%H5414><s%> forth <S%H5414><s%> its voice, <S%H6963><s%> It lifted <S%H5375><s%> high <S%H7315><s%> its hands. <S%H3027><s%>

Sun <S%H8121><s%> [and] moon <S%H3394><s%> stood <S%H5975><s%> in their places; <S%H2073><s%> They went <S%H1980><s%> away at the light <S%H216><s%> of Thine arrows, <S%H2671><s%> At the radiance <S%H5051><s%> of Thy gleaming <S%H1300><s%> spear. <S%H2595><s%>
In indignation <S%H2195><s%> Thou didst march <S%H6805><s%> through the earth; <S%H776><s%> In anger <S%H639><s%> Thou didst trample <S%H1758><s%> the nations. <S%H1471><s%>

Thou didst go <S%H3318><s%> forth <S%H3318><s%> for the salvation <S%H3468><s%> of Thy people, <S%H5971><s%> For the salvation <S%H3468><s%> of Thine anointed. <S%H4899><s%> Thou didst strike <S%H4272><s%> the head <S%H7218><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> of the evil <S%H7563><s%> To lay <S%H6168><s%> him open <S%H6168><s%> from thigh <S%H3247><s%> to neck. <S%H6677><s%> Selah. <S%H5542><s%>

Thou didst pierce <S%H9344><s%> with his own spears <S%H4294><s%> The head <S%H7218><s%> of his throngs. <S%H6518><s%> They stormed <S%H5590><s%> in to scatter <S%H6327><s%> us; Their exultation <S%H5951><s%> [was] like <S%H3644><s%> those Who devour <S%H398><s%> the oppressed <S%H6041><s%> in secret. <S%H4565><s%>
Thou didst tread <S%H1869><s%> on the sea <S%H3220><s%> with Thy horses, <S%H5483><s%> On the surge <S%H9148><s%> of many <S%H7227><s%> waters. <S%H4325><s%>

I heard <S%H8085><s%> and my inward <S%H990><s%> parts <S%H990><s%> trembled, <S%H7264><s%> At the sound <S%H6963><s%> my lips <S%H8193><s%> quivered. <S%H6750><s%> Decay <S%H7538><s%> enters <S%H935><s%> my bones, <S%H6106><s%> And in my place <S%H8478><s%> I tremble. <S%H7264><s%> Because <S%H834><s%> I must wait <S%H5117><s%> quietly <S%H5117><s%> for the day <S%H3117><s%> of distress, <S%H6869><s%> For the people <S%H5971><s%> to arise <S%H5927><s%> [who] will invade <S%H1464><s%> us.

Though <S%H3588><s%> the fig <S%H8384><s%> tree <S%H8384><s%> should not blossom, <S%H6524><s%> And there <S%H369><s%> be no <S%H369><s%> fruit <S%H2981><s%> on the vines, <S%H1612><s%> [Though] the yield <S%H4639><s%> of the olive <S%H2132><s%> should fail, <S%H3584><s%> And the fields <S%H7709><s%> produce <S%H6213><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> food, <S%H400><s%> Though the flock <S%H6629><s%> should be cut <S%H1504><s%> off <S%H1504><s%> from the fold, <S%H4356><s%> And there <S%H369><s%> be no <S%H369><s%> cattle <S%H1241><s%> in the stalls, <S%H7517><s%>
Yet I will exult <S%H5937><s%> in the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> I will rejoice <S%H1523><s%> in the God <S%H430><s%> of my salvation. <S%H3468><s%>

The Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3068><s%> is my strength, <S%H2428><s%> And He has made <S%H7760><s%> my feet <S%H7272><s%> like hinds' [feet,] And makes me walk <S%H1869><s%> on my high <S%H1116><s%> places. <S%H1116><s%> For the choir <S%H5329><s%> director, <S%H5329><s%> on my stringed <S%H5058><s%> instruments. <S%H5058><s%>
